meanings.definition: Capable of being assessed or evaluated.
meanings.sent1: The student's work was assessable by the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The property's value was assessable by the real estate agent.
meanings.sent3: The assessable puzzle was challenging but fun to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her assessable talent in painting shone brightly during the art exhibition.
meanings.sent5: The assessable impact of the new policy was evident to all.

meanings.sent1: The company's financial records were assessable by the auditors.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's performance was assessable by the coach.
meanings.sent3: The assessable cake was a hit at the bake sale.
meanings.sent4: His assessable dedication to his work was truly admirable.
meanings.sent5: The assessable risks of the project were carefully considered before proceeding.
